title.narrative: 1.1.2 CPD’s financial management and internal control policies and systems are satisfactory
1.1.2 statement: Strengthened financial management and internal control system and management support system

target.value: CPD strengthens its financial management and internal control related systems -Independent internal auditor recruited

actual.value: 100% progress CPD has strengthened its financial management and internal control related systems throughout the year. • An independent internal auditor has been recruited and is continuing his work independently since the last year. • The internal auditor prepares periodic reports for the CPD management.

target.value: -New accounting software in place for project-wise accounting -Properly maintained fixed assets register and inventory -Adequate procurement policy in place ? Improved financial control and strengthen financial management

actual.value: CPD appears to have made tangible progress in upgrading their financial management system and internal controls in consistency with good business practice, however, we have some observations and recommendations. Donors and CPD Board may consider our recommendations for further improvement. The practical implementation and compliance of these standards should be regularly monitored. We recommend that according to sound business practice and to avoid any conflict of interest, the Chair of the Audit Committee should be independent from any executive functions in the organization. Also, the existing Charter/ToR of the audit committee should be expanded to articulate the required qualification and experience of the Audit Committee members. The internal auditor needs to undergo training on internal audit methodology and he should report to the audit committee on a quarterly basis.

target.value: -Improved financial control and strengthen financial management

title.narrative: 1.1.3. statement: Enhanced human resources and organizational performance

target.value: -Assessment of staffing competence and staffing needs to deliver the strategic pathway -Finance staff have improved capacity -Capacity development plan developed for all employees

actual.value: CPD has argued for a premium for exclusive retention of their senior and exceptionally qualified resources. Salaries of positions from the Deputy Director level downwards should be reviewed by a professional HR expert to assess scope for further rationalization, if any. CPD needs to refine and discuss their rationalized staffing plan within themselves and then with the Donor. CPD obtained information on salary scale of two similar organisations, such as BIGD and TIB, and provided comparative summary of 11 positions. Regarding the capacity development plan, a need assessment across all the divisions should be undertaken to properly assess the development needs of individual staff, and proceed accordingly. All professionals are working in the Administration and Finance Division as per Work Plan. Conducted in-house trainings for admin, finance and Project Development, Resource Mobilisation and Learning (PRL) staff

target.value: -Staff size adjusted as per strategic plan
- Capacity development integrated through improved supervision and/or training - Staff size adjusted as per strategic plan

actual.value: • Training for employee’s capacity development will be held by November 2021. However, they are being closely monitored and supervised by their respective supervisor (Capacity development plan is in Annex Table: 4) • A rationalized staffing plan has been prepared with an optimal ratio of permanent and contractual staff
